answers.answer: Wow - this IS odd.. are you sure the lab hasn;t made an error on testing that? That is just not right..Can you have a repeat in that testing.I would do all of them again.I just don't know.
Yes, this is the third repeat in the past 6 weeks, and it keeps getting higher.948, 1048 and now 1156
You need to look up Dr. Norman on Parathyroid com.

question: I seem to have stumped all my doctors and am concerned about what these results really mean.  What dangers am I looking at with these numbers?I do have a burning sensation in my palms, that comes and goes.  A paratyroid tumor removed in 2005 and then a paratyroid removal and transplant in 2007, after which PTH did return to normal for 1 year.  I have been diagnosed with MEN-I and Type II Diabetes which is controlled through diet and exercise.PTH - 1156 (no, that is not a typo) and this is after 6 weeks of 1000mg Vitamin DCalcium - 9.4Vitamin D - normalMagnesium - normalKidney Function - normal
title: Extremely elevated PTH and normal calcium
